questions.question: I ......................................... him since last week.
questions.description: The present perfect is common with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: It .......................................... for hours.
questions.description: Use the present perfect if it is still raining.

questions.question: The train ...................................... 5 minutes ago.
questions.description: The simple past is used to talk about finished events.

questions.question: She .......................................... from Madras University.
questions.description: The simple past is the most common tense for talking about past events.

questions.question: She ..................................... homeless since she lost her job.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about actions or situations that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: What ........................................ then?
questions.description: We use the simple past with time expressions referring to the past.

questions.question: I ...................................... the parcel in the morning.
questions.description: We use the simple past with past time expressions.

questions.question: I ........................................ the letters.
questions.description: When there is no time reference, we are more likely to use a present perfect for recently finished actions and situations.

questions.question: It ........................................ yesterday.
questions.description: We use the simple past with past time expressions.

questions.question: The train ............................................ yet.
questions.description: The present perfect is more common with the expressions yet, already etc.

questions.question: I ......................................... to Australia.
questions.description: The present perfect is more common with the expressions never and ever.
